results.title: Impressionism
results.brief_description: Discusses the unique qualities of impressionism and shows examples of impressionistic master-pieces. The techniques are contrasted with the detailed photographic techniques of some former schools. Points of departure are in the selection of everyday subjects, the use of intense contrasts of light and shadow and bold generalised patterns using heavy applications of paint to give great action and movement.

results.title: The Impressionable years: American children and the public library
results.creator_credit: Peter Elgar and United States Information Service
results.brief_description: Describes a young girl’s first experience of the children’s room of the New York Public Library. Evokes in an imaginative way the pleasures, satisfactions and companionship children can find in reading. Shows story hours, simple reference work and borrowing routines. Emphasises the child’s freedom of choice and the way in which the library is scaled to their requirements. Narrated by Henry Fonda.

results.title: An Impression of London
results.creator_credit: William Pollard, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: The round-the-clock activities of a typical London day described by a young American girl in her diary. Arriving by air at dawn, she explores London - the Tower of London, a search for the site of Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, feeding the pigeons in Trafalgar Square, a glimpse of the procession of the Household Cavalry at Hyde Park Corner, the streets, shops and parks, a visit to a riverside pub at dusk, dinner at a West End restaurant and a midnight cabaret.

results.title: The Importance of making notes
results.brief_description: Discusses the important skills of note-taking, showing how to take good notes in oral instruction periods and during reading. Explains how to determine the key ideas for notes; describes the kinds of information which should be taken down verbatim, and points out when notes should not be taken at all.

results.title: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

video_links.name: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

results.brief_description: Shows how the three aims of controlled irrigation can be achieved in furrow irrigation by putting the “correct flow” down the furrows so as to obtain even distribution of the water over the whole area and down to the depth of the root zone. The various factors which determine “correct flow” are briefly considered and finally the method whereby it may be obtained and checked is outlined.
results.title_for_label: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

results.title: Importance of being frivolous
results.brief_description: A number of short amusing cartoons which show the advantages of an ordinary cheque account and the use of traveller’s cheques when overseas. Made for Barclay’s Bank, the cartoons have excellent commentaries.
